channel.title: I've had win7 for less than 2 hours... and already broke it
channel.description:
[img]http://i.imgur.com/WDFHE.png[/img]
...and 1 and a half hours was used to install the os, programs and drivers
PS: it fixed its self after about 15 mins
PPS: the "win7" driver for creative x-fi soundcard doesn't work on win7, go figure

item.title: I've had win7 for less than 2 hours... and already broke it
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

thiefmn6092:

i use a torrented Windows 7 x64, it’s not bad. LOL at that bug though

Me also I don’t understand what the problem is. I built my computers myself. I get all the drivers for the specific hardware and never had any problems. I also have it on my dads dell xps 210 pirated version, then I have it on my sisters laptop a dell e1505, and I used to have it on an old dell dimension before I sold it. Never had any problems.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:13, topic:373367”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=469382.msg3432776#msg3432776 date=1292502131]
if this is a thread about “windows is shit, linux is better” dont even get me started on the amount of problems i come across on linux.
[/quote]Niall used to run XP.

It all boils down to Win7 being inconsistent. On some computers it works fine, on some it does not (mine is one of those).[/quote]Mine is one of the ones that it works great on.

If there’s one thing I don’t like about Win7, it’s how they set up personal documents.

Read full topic

item.title: I've had win7 for less than 2 hours... and already broke it
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

Niall:

PPS: the “win7” driver for creative x-fi soundcard doesn’t work on win7, go figure

Mostly because Creative’s drivers suck ass. It’s the reason why I did away with my creative card, the drivers never worked properly.
Got an Asus Xonar D2X now, and the only annoying thing about it is that when a game crashes, the last 100ms of the sound gets repeated over and over.
Luckily I could fix it by using Auzentech’s X-Meridian drivers.

Read full topic
